commit.message:
Fix Appveyor test for coveralls (#407)

The environment GCOVR_TEST_SUITE has highest priority, ignoring the used CI.
Set PR in the data only if the environment is set to a value.

Fix Appveyor test for coveralls (#407)

The environment GCOVR_TEST_SUITE has highest priority, ignoring the used CI.
Set PR in the data only if the environment is set to a value.

commit.message:
Compare paths case insensitive #329 (#386)



- If cwd exist uppercase and lowercase the pattern match is also done case insensitive.

* Add suggestion from latk about problem if CWD in '/'.

* Added review points from chrta.

* Linter doesn't like extra spaces

commit.message:
Adding json_summary changes as one commit (#366)

* Added support for JSON summary output
Heads-up for those who have been using this branch:
Percentages are now in [0.0- 1.0] range instead of 0-100%
- summary version bumped to 0.2
- 'file' field is renamed to 'filename'
- Also, 'root' is relative to the report file.

- Also, 'root' is relative to the report file.

commit.message:
Early fail when output cannot be created (#382)

Check that the output files (as specified by command line options or in config files) can be written, before performing time-consuming actions. (closes #346)

In the course of testing this, additional problems were found and fixed:

* config files now properly handle file paths so that they are relative to the config file

* user-provided Jinja templates are now loaded from arbitrary locations
  * FileSystemLoader had problems in subdirectories under Windows
  * using a FunctionLoader fixes this

verification.payload:
tree ee99bf7a708a62a57ff7aafb2f14c480c246e4e6
parent fe2f0ac813226d4b5f6206bb9558679c0ab98bea
author Michael Förderer <40258682+Spacetown@users.noreply.github.com> 1591177022 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1591177022 +0000

Early fail when output cannot be created (#382)

Check that the output files (as specified by command line options or in config files) can be written, before performing time-consuming actions. (closes #346)

In the course of testing this, additional problems were found and fixed:

* config files now properly handle file paths so that they are relative to the config file

* user-provided Jinja templates are now loaded from arbitrary locations
  * FileSystemLoader had problems in subdirectories under Windows
  * using a FunctionLoader fixes this

commit.message: Configure tab size for HTML source page #277

Extend tests to use an unified diff in the assert #374

- Replace global variable GENERATE_REFERENCE with option --generate-reference.
- Add option --update_reference to update the reference data if there are differences.
- Add option --skip_clean to keep test output.

Use HTML title also for report heading (#296)

- Default for option --title changed to "GCC Code Coverage Report".

update test references

due to merging multiple PRs, the tests were slightly out of sync

Add feature suggested in issue #369

- Change legend in html.
- --html-medium-threshold must be greater 0.
Add --exclude-lines-by-pattern to filter out source lines by arbitrary regex
Set make variable TEST_OPTS as environment variable inside docker.
Add --csv output generation

Merge html-rewrite

The HTML output was completely overhauled and now features more modern
HTML that should be easier to extend. Importantly, CSS no longer has to
be inline!

This represents roughly six months of "work". Thank you for @opikalo
(#367) for dragging it over the finish line :)
Skipping coverage for reference file generation code.

Minore refactor to address failing tests.

We do not need individual coverage file reports since they tend to
confuse reference machinery. Also, trying to fix windows HTML
scrubber.

Added regeneration code and fixed regex

All files could be regenerated wheb GENERATE_REFENCE = True.
Also, minor change to regexp to accomodate for html rewrite.
Re-added regenerated html and json files.
